action.textblock: Notice of proposed cooperative research and development agreement (CRADA) negotiations.

summary.textblock: The United States Geological Survey (USGS) has entered into a Cooperative Research and Development Agreement (CRADA) with CQ Inc. The purpose of the CRADA is to develop models for predicting the fate of potentially toxic trace elements in commercial coal cleaning procedures. Any other organization interested in pursuing the possibility of a CRADA for similar kinds of activities should contact the USGS.

address.textblock: Inquiries may be addressed to the Chief, Branch of Coal Geology, U.S. Geological Survey, Mail Stop 972, Denver Federal Center, Denver, CO 80225; telephone 303-236-7726, FAX 303-236-7738.

further.textblock: Dr. Robert B. Finkelman of the U.S. Geological Survey, Branch of Coal Geology, Mail Stop 956, Reston, VA 22092, telephone (703) 648-6412, FAX (703) 648-6419.

supplem.textblock: This notice is to meet the USGS requirement stipulated in the Survey Manual.
